thread.title: Jeremy Vine: Strictly Come Dancing 2015 contestant
thread.title_full: Jeremy Vine: Strictly Come Dancing 2015 contestant - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Jeremy Vine: Strictly Come Dancing 2015 contestant
text: BBC journalist and radio DJ Jeremy Vine is swapping his famous swingometer for swing dancing this autumn. Jeremy's partner, Karen Cliften (née Hauer), has been dancing professionally on Strictly Come Dancing since 2012, and is married to fellow Strictly professional, Kevin Clifton. Jeremy has shown maximum enthusiasm but minimal finesse in the opening two weeks and he didn't disappoint in week three when he and Karen performed the Charleston to Top Hat, White Tie & Tails from Top Hat. "You really have become the king of funny walks," said Bruno. Week three Dance : charleston Scores : Craig: 3 - Darcey: 7 - Len: 7 - Bruno: 7. TOTAL: 24 Jeremy provides great entertainment value but isn't going to last the course. Week two Dance: American Smooth Scores: Craig: 3 - Darcey: 5 - Len: 5 - Bruno: 3. TOTAL: 17 Third from the bottom of the leaderboard but safely through to next week. Week one Dance: Cha cha cha Scores: Craig: 2 - Darcey: 6 - Len: 6 - Bruno: 5. TOTAL: 19 The bottom-wiggling Radio 2 presenter danced a cha cha to September by Earth, Wind and Fire. "That dance would qualify for the World Dad Dancing Championships," said Craig, calling Jeremy's bottom wiggles "bizarre." But Darcey called it "strangely fabulous" and the studio audience agreed. The build-up The 50-year-old said that his family were very supportive of his decision to go on the show, and revealed that the eldest of his two daughters has encouraged him. "She said, 'If you wanna do it dad, you do it'", he told Evans. Vine said: “How could I say no to the biggest show in TV? Yes, yes, yes and yes again to the sequins and the Samba! Now I just need to find some dancing shoes and identify my left foot. "I am doing it for my two young daughters who jumped behind the sofa when I told them! It seems Dad on Strictly is more scary than Doctor Who!” he added. • Strictly Come Dancing 2015: contestant line-up "I am genuinely miles and miles outside my comfort zone. In rehearsals, it was rather like sitting at the piano, and you can't play piano, and someone shouts "Play Rachmaninoff", like that. They just said, "Do a waltz" and I thought "I don't even know what a b---dy waltz is!" TelegraphEnts
